Basic details: Emily Johnson, an 8-year-old girl, comes to the clinic with newly diagnosed diabetes.
Vitals:
BP: 110/70 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 20/minute
HR: 85/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting on the examination table, looking anxious.
Frequent urination observed, as she asks to use the restroom multiple times.
Exhibits signs of fatigue and thirst, drinking water from a cup continuously.
If blood glucose testing is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What is a blood glucose test?”
Challenging question: “Will I have to take insulin forever? Can I still eat sweets?”
